archimate:Resource.name: Two-Way Request-Response Pattern
archimate:Resource.documentation: This is the most common messaging pattern, also called request-reply. It has good support from a large amount of middleware. It is the equivalent of a one way pull and two way message exchange pattern (MEP) in terms of functionality and capability. It can be implemented either synchronously or asynchronously. When implemented asynchronously if the time between the request and response is significant, a separate signal message can be used to confirm the receipt of the request message.
